pr_title: [Issue 2600] find a common ancestor slot to sync from

timeline.message:
[Issue 2600] find a common ancestor slot to sync from

 - If there are at least 10_000 slots after the local finalized slot, interrogate a set of slots in the range of 3000-2000 behind our head slot, and see if there are any in common with the peer. If that finds a match, use that as the first slot to sync from. Otherwise, sync from the finalized checkpoint as previously.

 fixes #2600

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: 10,000 slots seems like it's too many.  I wonder if we should just make this the same as optimistic history length. We only make one extra request if we trigger this logic so it's very cheap compared to downloading all the blocks since finalisation.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: I think we want localHead.min(status.getHeadSlot()) because in rare cases it's possible that the peer has a lower head slot but a higher finalised epoch which would cause us to sync to it.  This would be the case if 2/3rds of the Medalla validators all attested that there had been no blocks since finalisation stopped - head block would be back in epoch 2289 but the finalised epoch would be 3287.
timeline.author: ajsutton
ajsutton

replies.bodyText: And probably invert the if condition so that we return early instead of having the whole method inside the if.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Probably make these constants and show the calculation - ie that it's important they total just 1000 slots, and with a comment about Prysm's limitations.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: nit: Make MINIMUM_VIABLE_SLOTS a UInt in the constant to make this more readable.
timeline.author: ajsutton
